semanticStructure.description: Use semantic HTML elements to structure the survey (form, fieldset, legend, label). Ensure each survey question is clearly grouped and labeled.

keyboardNavigation.description: Ensure full keyboard operability. All survey fields and controls must be navigable via keyboard, with logical focus order and visible focus indicators.

visualDesign.description: Maintain sufficient color contrast (min 4.5:1 for text), avoid reliance on color alone, and ensure responsive layout with text scaling up to 200%.

formControlsAndErrorHandling.description: All form inputs must have clear labels and instructions. Error messages must be displayed, clearly linked to the input, and announced via ARIA live regions.

dynamicContent.description: For surveys with multi-step processes or conditional questions, ensure that dynamic changes are announced via ARIA live regions, and that progress indicators are accessible.
dynamicContent.compliance: WCAG 2.1 SC 4.1.3 and ARIA live region best practices

ariaAndCustomControls.description: Implement ARIA roles, states, and properties for any custom survey controls. Ensure custom components behave like native controls.

mobileAccessibility.description: Design for responsiveness and mobile usability. Touch targets must be large enough, layouts should adjust for various orientations, and the survey must support mobile assistive technologies.
mobileAccessibility.compliance: WCAG 2.1 SC 1.3.4, WCAG 2.2 SC 2.5.8 (for touch target size)

documentationAndSupport.description: Include an accessibility statement and offer accessible help/support options. Ensure any external documentation is also accessible.

testingAndCompliance.description: Integrate automated accessibility testing (axe-core, Lighthouse) and conduct manual testing with screen readers and keyboard-only navigation. Generate compliance reports for legal auditing.
